intro: Urera caracasana var. miquelii, commonly known as the Miquel's urera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
